title.value: Вредоносность сорных растений в посевах яровой тритикале
Weed plants harmfulness in spring triticale seedlings

person.name: Pestereva, A.S., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In course of the research there were determined the period of greatest injuriousness (critical period) of weeds in crops of spring triticale (Triticosecale) cultivar Uzor and mineral nutrition elements removal (N, P2O5, K2O, CaO, MgO) from soil depending on crop development stage, evaluation of its impact on productivity. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2010-2011 (Priluki, Minsk region) on a trial field of the Institute of Plant Protection in flax crops on sod-podzolic moderately loamy soil. As a result of realized research it was revealed, that during this period weed plants took out from soil 12.8 kg/ha of nitrogen, 18.0 kg/ha of phosphorus, 46.6 kg/ha of potassium, 4.6 kg/ha of calcium, 2.9 kg/ha of magnesium. Weed plants most harmfulness period was determined, which let detect spring triticale weeding optimal terms: till tillering end stage – 1 node of crop. Mass of weeds and spring triticale and mineral nutrition elements removal in dynamics, dependence of spring triticale crop yields on duration of joint vegetation with weeds and removal by their mineral nutrition elements was presented.
